title: Sailors of the Battleship Navy

content: Nice article on the "old gals", about how it used to be... OH, the main target for the Imperial Japanese at Pearl Harbor wasn't the battleships, it was the carriers, only they were out at sea during the attack... They were glamorous, they were impressive and were the "big stick" of their day... Nation's fortunes were placed in them and there was a "battleship race" and treaties were negotiated around them, as to size, weaponry, number and tonnage... Even by today's standards, their "rifles" are impressive... Too bad their day has come and gone, they were graceful and their crews took great pride in being "battleship sailors"... Respectfully, SUNLINER81

title: Sailors of the Battleship Navy

content: I think it was in 1984, the last time I was at GTMO...we were pulling out onboard our USCG cutter and passed by one of the last US Battleships. I think it was the Iowa but can't remember. Man, that thing was HUGE! It was anchored out in the harbor as I believe it was too large to dock. Don
